bibl.title: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to James E. Peabody, October 11, 1928

div1.p: Russell suggests that Peabody donate his papers related to his yellow fever research to the Johns Hopkins Hospital Library.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick F. Russell to James E. Peabody, October 11, 1928

opener.dateline:
The Rockefeller Foundation
International Health Division,
61 Broadway, N. Y. City.
October 11, 1928.

div1.p:
. . . . When you have finished your present work on yellow fever
might it not be a good thing to deposit say in the library of the Johns
Hopkins Hospital all the letters which you have collected on this
subject, in order that they may may be cared for and be considered by
any historian of the future who is writing up the subject of yellow fever
studies? The librarian is Professor William H. Welch, whom of course
you know.
div1.closer: Very Sincerely yours, F. F. Russell, Director.
